DOC.brief_title: Promoting Vegetable Intake Preschool Aged Children
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study test efficacy repeat taste exposure intervention , nutritional educational intervention combination increase intake unfamiliar vegetable preschool age child ( age 3-5 year ) . In particular study ass whether strategy effective encourage intake unfamiliar vegetable child fussy eater go food neophobia phase . The effectiveness intervention also observe overtime 3 6 month post intervention . Nurseries randomise one four condition 12 week intervention period ; include educational intervention , taste exposure , taste exposure educational intervention intervention ( control group ) . All child offer unfamiliar vegetable prior intervention intervention evaluate change intake unfamiliar vegetable . The repeated taste exposure group offer novel vegetable repeatedly ( 1 exposure per week ) 12 week period . For educational intervention nursery staff advise deliver two component exist PhunkyFoods educational programme period . Parents ask general demographic question , child food behaviour question question feed practice . Finally nursery staff request provide feedback evaluate intervention feasibility , barrier efficacy . It predict child 's intake unfamiliar vegetable vary intervention . The primary hypothesis test child receive repeat taste exposure likely increase intake unfamiliar vegetable compare educational control condition . The second hypothesis repeat taste exposure increase intake unfamiliar vegetable fussy eater education .
DOC.criteria: 2 5 year old Attends nursery select test day Relevant food allergy ( mooli / radish ) Medical condition would prevent eat test vegetable
